column1: The boat was cast on an island
column2: and Prospero and his little one landed in safety. Now this island was enchanted
column3: and for years had lain under the spell of a fell witch
column5: who had imprisoned in the trunks of trees all the good spirits she found there. She died shortly before Prospero was cast on those shores
column7: of whom Ariel was the chief
column8: still remained in their prisons.Prospero was a great magician
column9: for he had devoted himself almost entirely to the study of magic during the years in which he allowed his brother to manage the affairs of Milan. By his art he set free the imprisoned spirits
column10: yet kept them obedient to his will
column11: and they were more truly his subjects than his people in Milan had been. For he treated them kindly as long as they did his bidding
column12: and he exercised his power over them wisely and well. One creature alone he found it necessary to treat with harshness: this was Caliban
column13: the son of the wicked old witch
column17: and vicious and brutal in all his habits.
